Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that "nothing was denied" to the special counsel from the Trump administration, which contradicts the findings of the Mueller report.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Mueller report did not establish that the Trump campaign coordinated or conspired with the Russian government in its election-interference activities.
Understate: The claim understates the findings of the Mueller report, which stated that it does not exonerate President Trump from obstruction of justice.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or specific details to back up the statement that "nothing was denied" to the special counsel.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that Clinton obstructed justice, without providing sufficient evidence to support this claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that the Mueller report did not reach a conclusion on obstruction of justice and highlighted the difficulties in making a judgment on the matter.
